newsitem.title: USA: GM sets mostly unchanged Q3 output forecast.
newsitem.headline: GM sets mostly unchanged Q3 output forecast.

text.p: General Motors Corp said Friday it expects to produce 1,309,000 cars and trucks at its North American operations in the third quarter, a decrease of 2,000 from its previous forecast.

GM forecast production of 715,000 cars and 594,000 trucks in the third quarter, up four percent from the year-earlier total of 1,258,000 vehicles. Previously it forecast third quarter production of 716,000 cars and 595,000 trucks.
GM said it produced a total of 1,459,000 vehicles -- 809,000 cars and 650,000 trucks -- in the second quarter, down six percent from the year-ago 1,549,000.
GM said that in June it produced 259,000 cars and 207,000 trucks for a total of 466,000 vehicles, down from 499,000 a year earlier.
Including revised estimates from Ford Motor Co and Chrysler Corp, the U.S. Big Three automakers project third quarter production of 2,843,900 vehicles a slight increase from 2,838,000 a year ago.
The total reflects projected output of 1,237,600 cars, an eight percent decline from last year, and 1,606,300 trucks, a seven percent increase.
